field.name: description
field.value:
SetValidator will validate the contents of a property against a set of known values. In all cases. the string representation of the property (via the ToString() method) is compared to a set of strings.
The ValidateSetAttribute has six possible constructors:
1> ValidateSetAttribute() 2> ValidateSetAttribute(string errorMessage) 3> ValidateSetAttribute(params string[] set) 4> ValidateSetAttribute(string errorMessage, params string[] set) 5> ValidateSetAttribute(Type type) 6> ValidateSetAttribute(Type type, string errorMessage)
Numbers 1-2 create an empty validation set. Numbers 3-4 create a validation set based on the provided string(s). Numbers 5-6 create a validation set based on the values of an enum.
The SetValidator implementation has three constructors:
1> SetValidator() 2> SetValidator(params string[] set) 3> SetValidator(Type type)
The IsValid() returns true if the value is null or an empty string, or if the value is in the set. Comparison to the set is a simple iteration of the set (a string array). Not efficient if sets are huge, but that little piece can be enhanced if considered necessary.
